author: WTVG Staff
title: Local expert discusses risks from PowerSchool cybersecurity breach
text: TOLEDO, Ohio (WTVG) - A popular platform for school districts to keep track of student records and communicate with families was hit by a data breach last month that has just come to light.It’s called PowerSchool and it’s probably a familiar name for many in the 13 Action News viewers. It’s a cloud-based software platform used in K-12 schools.Sylvania City Schools came forward Thursday afternoon to say their platform was not involved. Now a local expert is discussing what risk this could post for any districts that were affected. He said the data breach is certainly a cause for concern, but there is no need for parents to panic.Jason Slagle is the president of CNWR Consultants, a local IT consulting firm that focuses on providing tech support for small businesses.“This program is used by schools all over the nation,” Slagle told 13 Action News.He also has two children who go to school in a local district that uses the software platform. “PowerSchool is a student information system. So what it does is provide services such as grade book, student tracking, scheduling and other resources that schools use to operate essentially. You can’t do that stuff on paper anymore, so almost every district uses some kind of electronic system to do its record keeping,” Slagle said.Slagle said the information that was exposed was mainly contact information, but in some cases it could include social security numbers.“It definitely has name, date of birth, parent contact information, their entire schedule and grades, all of that information that schools require to operate,” Slagle said.According to PowerSchool, someone used compromised credentials to access student and teacher information through one of PowerSchool’s community-focused customer support portals. “The school districts did nothing wrong. They chose what is considered a best in class product to do this work and keep track of these records for them,” Slagle said.So if your district is impacted by the breach, what can you do?“One of the things you can do is monitor your credit. If you have older children, they are able to get credit, and if you do have seniors in high school you wouldn’t want the threat actors to open credit cards in their name,” Slagle said.PowerSchool is trying to assure families that it is staying on top of this. The company said in a statement:“We have taken all appropriate steps to prevent the data involved from further unauthorized access or misuse.”It went on to say “we are equipped to conduct a thorough notification process to all impacted individuals.”If you haven’t already heard from your school district, Slagle said you should reach out and ask if your district was impacted. title: #8 Jesús y Palestina
text:
[Esteban_Rosador](/user/Esteban_Rosador)a [infolibre.es](/go/link/3891749) [#1](c1#c-1) También imprescindible el otro libro que menciona el artículo, "La invención del pueblo judío" de Shlomo Sand. No me cansaré de recomendarlo. Mediante estudios genéticos demuestra que los los judios asquenazíes de Europa, que fueron la hegemonía fundacional de Israel y el 51.6% de los judíos del Israel actual, proceden de los jázaros convertidos al judaísmo en el siglo VII. No tienen por tanto orígenes semitas sino túrquicos (actual noroeste de Turquía). Shlomo Sand demuestra que los actuales palestinos son los verdaderos descendientes de los campesinos israelitas originarios pero convertidos al Islam por lo que tienen más similitudes genéticas con los israelitas originales que los judíos actuales de Israel. La ironía es que segun la Torá, les corresponde a ellos, a los actuales palestinos descendientes de Abraham, heredar la tierra... y los antisemitas serían por tanto los actuales judíos de Israel.
Conferencia de Shlomo Sand sobre "La invención del pueblo judío"
Al final será como un Jeremías Springfield, sólo que para mantener la esperanza nos toca decir: "fue uno grande"

title: 筑牢安全防线！郑州航空港区开展物业管理领域消防防汛应急演练 - 中国日报网
text:
为切实保障居民生命财产安全，全面提升物业管理领域应急处突能力，7月1日上午，郑州航空港区组织开展2025年物业管理领域消防、防汛应急演练观摩活动。来自建设局、应急管理局、消防救援支队等部门及各乡镇（办事处）、物业服务企业的200余名负责人现场观摩，共筑安全防线。
此次演练聚焦防汛与消防两大重点，64名参演人员协同作战，通过情景模拟、实战操作展现应急处置全流程。防汛演练以北门地库口险情为背景，随着水位观察员发出预警，防汛挡板快速架设、沙袋层层堆砌，地库车辆有序疏散，积水抽排、环境消杀等环节紧密衔接，同步开放防汛仓库展示物资储备规范。
消防演练设置三大实战场景：地库内新能源汽车突发火情，消防控制室接警后迅速响应，利用防火挡板、降温花洒装置控制火势；8号楼坡道口非机动车起火，巡逻岗第一时间启用防火勾、灭火毯扑灭火苗；8号楼高层火灾现场，救援人员在扑灭初期火灾的同时，成功解救被困群众，并通过心肺复苏、人工呼吸等急救措施挽回生命，完整呈现从接警、处置到救援的全链条应急流程。
"演练流程科学规范，对物业日常安全管理极具指导意义！"永威物业负责人王卉在观摩后表示，此次活动有效强化了从业人员的安全意识与实操能力。建设局副局长崔宗晓在总结部署中强调，各单位要以"人民至上、生命至上"为准则，将安全责任扛在肩上、落在实处，行业部门需加强协同联动，通过明察暗访相结合的方式，常态化开展消防、防汛督导检查，全力建设"平安港区"。
此次演练通过"实战练兵+经验共享"模式，进一步完善了郑州航空港区物业管理领域应急工作机制，为应对极端天气和突发灾害积累了宝贵经验，切实提升区域安全治理水平。（中国日报河南记者站史宝银|陈锋钺）
